Any - Class in util
For when you want to return multiple different values in a less awkward way
Use only with objects since autoboxing is costly
These act as generic containers
The only argument against primitive holders is that you might as well make an array, and if you have multiple types, bundle them together or make your own class for that purpose
Any.O2<A,B> - Class in util
Generic 2-object container
Any.O3<A,B,C> - Class in util
Generic 2-object container
applyCurveTo(Curve, double, double[]) - Static method in class main.Samples
Apply curve to some array as an envelope
applyCurveToData(Curve) - Method in class main.Samples
Apply curve as envelope to sample data
applyCurveToInParallel(Curve, double, double[]...) - Static method in class main.Samples
Apply curve to some arrays as an envelope
applyCurveToSpectrum(Curve) - Method in class main.Samples
Apply curve as envelope to spectrum correctly
Doing the extra calculation is necessary, otherwise the mapping will be wrong.
applyTo(MetaSamples) - Method in interface main.Track
Take the existing samples and do whatever with them
Can overlay audio data, apply effects, etc.
applyTo(MetaSamples) - Method in class main.TrackLayerCompound
 
applyTo(MetaSamples) - Method in class main.TrackLayerSimple
 
array(Object...) - Static method in class util.Hash
Shortcut for generic hashing
Slower than direct hashing, but easier to use
Can hash arrays
ARRAY_MULT - Static variable in class util.Hash
The default multiplier used for array hashes
ARRAY_ROOT - Static variable in class util.Hash
The default starting value used for array hashes
autoUpdate() - Method in class main.Samples
Check for discrepancy, automatically choose FFT or IFFT
Use via API is discouraged, know whether you want FFT or IFFT and call that instead
